page.title: 08BOLTON PERCY LANDSCAPE
page.content: Land around the village is held by 4 {farming}families;one has farmed there since Tudor times.The farms are about 230 acres each.Barley,hay and oilseed rape are the main crops.There are some acres of pasture for store cattle,on ridge and furrow or "landed" fields dating from the middle ages.They surround the houses. Isolated pockets of{woodland}are used for rearing game for shooting. The York & Ainsty Hunt (South)hunt fox over all the area.These are minority sports. The{Foss}flows through the village with flat land (Ings) on either side which are flooded in winter by opening flood gates on the Wharfe (4kms away) to protect lower Wharfedale. The{railway}to Leeds(1850's) & London (1983)passes Bolton on E & W.The station was closed in the 1960's.
